vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἀνα-δείκνῡμι,
also ἀναδεικνύω [Refs 1st c.AD+]: Ionic aorist -έδεξα[Refs 5th c.BC+]: perfect -δέδειχα[Refs 2nd c.BC+]:—lift up and show, exhibit, display, πύλας ἀναδεικνύναι display by opening gates, i.e. throw wide the gates, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀναδέξαι ἀσπίδα hold up shield as signal, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἀνέδεξε σημήιον τοῖς ἄλλοις ἀνάγεσθαι made signal for them to put to sea, [Refs]; [Μίλητος] Θαλῆν ἀ., on a statue, epigram cited in [Refs 3rd c.AD+]
__II notify, especially proclaim any one as elected to office, αὑτὸν ἀναδεδειχὼς βασιλέα[Refs 2nd c.BC+]; ἀ. τινὰ μέγιστον make him the greatest man,[NT]:—passive, ἀναδεδεῖχθαι τὸ ἱερὸν ἄσυλον[Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__II.2 dedicate, τῷ Διὶ ταῦρον[Refs 5th c.BC+]; τὴν Πιερίδα ταῖς θεαῖς[Refs 1st c.BC+]
__II.3 ἀ. πόλεμον declare war, [Refs 1st c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to show, appoint
primarily to show anything by raising it aloft, as a torch; to display, manifest, show plainly or openly, Acts 1:24; to mark out, constitute by some outward sign, Lk. 10:1*
